snippet: A statue of the Virgin Mary that still stands in Breezy Point, Queens, after Hurricane Sandy and fire destroyed the house beside it has become a much-visited, much-discussed symbol of survival.
abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column notes reports that a statue of the Virgin Mary still stands in Breezy Point, Queens, after Hurricane Sandy and fire destroyed the house beside it; statue has become a much-visited, much-discussed symbol of survival.
lead_paragraph: A statue of the Virgin Mary that still stands in Breezy Point, Queens, after Hurricane Sandy and fire destroyed the house beside it has become a much-visited, much-discussed symbol of survival.

headline.print_headline: Amid the Ashes, A Statue of Mary Stands as a Symbol Of Survival
headline.seo: A Madonna Survived the Storm in Breezy Point
headline.main: Amid the Ashes, a Statue of Mary Stands as a Symbol of Survival
